summary: Earl J. Williamson was a CIA employee, as evidenced by his official personnel folder which contains records of his employment, including reassignments, performance evaluations, awards, and a letter commending his service on the Clandestine Service Personnel Evaluation Board. One document mentions him in the context of the AMBUD program, specifically related to dependency payments and survivor benefits at JMWAVE. Another document mentions AMCLEVE/15's connection to Frank "Lefty" Rosenthal, but Williamson's direct involvement in this matter is not specified in the provided summaries.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Earl J. Williamson's significance in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated. His role appears to be primarily related to his employment within the CIA and his involvement in programs like AMBUD. Further information would be needed to determine any direct or indirect connection to the JFK assassination.
